titleStmt.title: Good counsell for young vvooers shewing the way, the meanes, and the skill, to wooe any woman, be she what she will: then all young men that are minded to wooe, come heare this new ballad, and buy't ere you goe. To a dainty new tune, or else it may be sung to the tune of Prettie Bessie.
titleStmt.author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?

titleStmt.title: Good counsell for young vvooers shewing the way, the meanes, and the skill, to wooe any woman, be she what she will: then all young men that are minded to wooe, come heare this new ballad, and buy't ere you goe. To a dainty new tune, or else it may be sung to the tune of Prettie Bessie.
titleStmt.author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?

notesStmt.note: Signed: M. P., i.e. Martin Parker.
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Printer's and publisher's names and estimated publication date from STC.
Verse - "Come all you young pupils that yet haue no skill,".
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
